title: How do psychiatrists unwind at the end of the day? - Quora

response.answer_text: I imagine that at the end of a day dealing with patients and there problems they take them selves home pour a large drink and stick on One flew over the Cuckoos nest or silence of the lambs to help themselves remember things haven’t got that bad yet (just kidding) I’m guessing because I’m not a psychiatrist but my old school friends father was a psychiatrist and when I would go to his home his father spent much time reading and writing and listening to jazz from his midi system (early 80s no apple or Spotify then) but was a quietly spoken man who showed genuine interest in all things from visitors to his home. He died in the late 90s from cancer but I remember him fondly. Jason uk.
Psychiatrist are basically people too, so we unwind as any other person would. with things that relieve our stress eg:-music, exercise, meditation , sleep etc.
